name: Hostel Ruthensteiner

reviews.title: You get what you pay for
reviews.text: My sisters and I shared a room. We paid only 30 Euros.

reviews.title: Frindly, well equipped, nice atmosphere
reviews.text: We got a great price because the hostal offers minimal services. The room was small. The bathrooms and showers, of course, were a short walk away. The floor outside of the showers was dirty.

reviews.title: Cute hostel
reviews.text: So this is a good place to stay if you just need a place to crash for the night.

reviews.title: Small dorms
reviews.text: I connected to the Internet in the hostel lounge.

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.text: After en epic over night train from Zurich we were able to check in early. Rooms were clean and airy. Facilities include kitchen, washing machines, lockers and breakfast can be purchased. Nice courtyard and dining areas with a bar. Close to the main train station but some distance from the city centre. The staff are great; it's a real credit to them! Cosy atmosphere :)

This felt like a dorm room, on my first night of college when you just want to go home. When I fist walked in the place seemed a little instituntional, kind of similar to the lobby in my highschool. Then after I check in they sent me accross the street to the annex! It was dark and empty, and I found my room in a white room with 10 white bunk beds. The shower was warm, but it had an automatic turn off to prevent long showers... harsh in the dead of winter.
reviews.title: Impersonal...

reviews.text: The location is ok, near the train station but not much else. Also, breakfast isn't free which kind of sucks.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been to a large collection of hostels on my trip, but this is my favorite so far. The staff are all extremely nice, the owners are very kind and helpful, the location is fabulous, beds are comfy. I really enjoyed it here. Great place to meet people.
reviews.title: A travellers oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hostel Ruthensteiner was really great. The staff were super friendly and the atmosphere really cheery and yet relaxed. There were guitars and a piano for people to play, a lovely lounging space, great kitchen and a garden courtyard. The hostel has been around for a few years but has been beautifully renovated and provides all the services any traveller needs.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We stayed across the street in one of the Garden Apartments...a super beautifully renovated one bedroom apartment with a very spacious lounge-dining room-kitchen (fully equipped)....and we could step out the door into a lovely sun-filled garden, to drink our morning coffee - even though in November it was getting chilly.
reviews.title: Their Webpage does not lie...

reviews.text: Incredibly nice. The hostel is very cheap, and yet, clean and pleasant, plenty of common space. Really nice kitchen, laundry, plenty of seats and tables to relax, drink, socialise, work (power plugs everywhere and free wireless). One can play piano, there are two guitars and a bongo. Plenty of tourist guides and books (also to exchange). Small pub. Inner courtyard with tables and seats. I had a single room (very small) but with washbasin and wardrobe. Comfortable bed and extremely silent at night. Staff is very friendly. I cannot imagine a more pleasant and social place to be.
reviews.title: could not be better

reviews.text: I was in Vienna in peak season so of course the hostel was noisy at night but never harmed my sleep. They gathered in the lounge downstairs to drink and socialized. I was in my single room on the 2nd floor sleeping like an angel. Location was good, 100m from streetcar and 300m from Central Train Station and underground. Supermarket was 100m away. I had the tiniest room I have ever seen in my life, like a cute jail cell but it was just what I needed for the price I paid: Clean, airy with big window looking into a small backyard with trees. Bedding was comfortable. I am a very light sleeper but I slept very well every night there even though my room was right at the staircase (I had ear-plugs). Bathrooms are clean and nice, good pressured hot shower. I think EUR38 was pretty good value in peak season for a clean single room. EUR30 would have been great value though. It was very safe in Vienna and around the hostel, even at midnight I came back from concerts by underground and walking. FREE WIFI in the room, which is a big plus for me.
reviews.title: Clean and good value!

reviews.text: This is the most overrated hostel I have seen here on TA. By far the most nosiest hostel I have ever stay at. This hostel has rooms on both side of the streets, therefore you can here noises coming from every single angle. My first night there, there were traveling students next to my dorm, I could hear exactly what they were discussing at 1am. Despite the sign that ask travelers that the city quiet time is 10pm, the students were yapping throughout the night and the hostel did nothing about it until a lady screamed out the window and the hostel finally issued a "hush" to the students.
reviews.title: Way Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 8 bed dorm is very small, bathroom is ok but the shower is ridiculously small. They charged 2 euros to use the internet for 45 minutes, 3 euro for sheets and 2 euro for towels, yes they charge for sheets and towels.
reviews.title: Outstanding, modern hostel. Great staff. Decent location. Would stay again.

reviews.text: Did not get a good night sleep my 3 nights here, street noises at 3 am, hostel located a breath away from a bar down the street, when the bar closes, guess what ? Drunks everywhere.
reviews.title: if only all hostels were as good!!
What more could one ask in a foreign land...... a safe, clean, friendly, affordable place to stay
reviews.text: I was traveling Europe alone for nearly a month. I had booked myself in budget, well-reviewed hostels in most countries. Trust me..... my stay in Vienna of all was one of the most memorable one. After a day long walk from museums to museums, parks to operas.....what more could one ask for???? A real, safe, clean, friendly affordable place to stay.

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: Ruthensteiner Hostel was just perfect. I was in an all women dorm. It was super clean and a very cheerful atmosphere. Every person behind the desk was approachable and most helpful. I recommend Erin's Hostel to all my friends without any reservation. Thanks Erin and team

reviews.title: A friendly, very nice & clean place to stay
reviews.text: Anu from Bangalore, India

reviews.title: fells a lot like home
reviews.text: We went to Vienna on a trip from Budapest just to get out of Budapest for a while. We took the train straight into Westbanhof which is like 4 blocks away. Plus there's metros and trams nearby. We ended up extending our visit by a night. Super nice people at the front desk. Enjoyed my morning hot chocolate from the little breakfast corner. Nice clean rooms as well with lockers and the kitchen had all the necessary dishes with strange stoves. Vienna is a wonderful city and so is this hostel.

reviews.title: Just a bit further than the two popular Wombats hostels, this is cheaper and more personable.
reviews.text: Hostel Ruthensteiner is located close to Westbahnhof ( West Railway Station), few minutes from the paradise of shopping in Vienna : Mariahilferstrasse. The breakfast is a little too expensive for it's contents ( just a cup of coffee or tea or milk and some cereals for 2,5 euro) but you can choose a wide sorts of food in the supermarkets nearby! The kitchen is simply wonderful, because it has a microwave, two electric oven, two big refrigerators, and all the plates and dishes you need, and even four or five washing machines.

description: * Vienna's original independent backpacker's hostel, Hostel Ruthensteiner is the perfect place to stay - with its friendly, international atmosphere in a smoke-free environment. * "One of a kind" and not "one of a chain", our fun hostel is run by family and good friends and is the ideal hostel for the individual traveller or small family groups. * Newly renovated, our early 1800's historical building is just a stone's throw from the Westbahnhof Train Station and equidistant between the City Center and lovely Palace Schoenbrunn. Here, weary travelers can rest their bodies and refresh their souls! * "Cleanliness & friendliness" is our motto, helping you feel at home is our passion!
